item.title: 首席执行官辞职后，金巴利的顶级投资者买入股票，推动集团发展
item.description: Davide Campari-Milano NV 的控股股东表示，将购买高达 1 亿欧元（1.11 亿美元）的股票，在其首席执行官突然辞职一天后，这将对这家意大利烈酒制造商起到提振作用。【原文：The controlling shareholder of Davide Campari-Milano NV said it will buy up to €100 million ($111 million) of shares in a boost for the Italian spirits maker a day after its chief executive officer abruptly quit.】

item.title: 新业务激增，发现公司利润攀升；计划分红
item.description: 发现保险公司（Discovery Ltd.）表示，由于新业务激增以及南非新成立的银行部门亏损减少，南非最大的保险公司全年利润增长了 12%。【原文：Discovery Ltd. said a surge in new business and smaller losses at its fledgling banking unit in South Africa boosted full-year profit for the nation’s biggest insurer by 12%.】

item.title: 挪威保持利率稳定，并发出 2025 年首次降息的信号
item.description: 挪威央行坚持世界上最鹰派的货币政策立场之一，使投资者对其最快将于今年首次下调借贷成本的希望破灭。【原文：Norway’s central bank is sticking with one of the rich world’s most hawkish monetary policy stances, dashing investor hopes that it would advance plans for a first cut in borrowing costs as soon as this year.】

item.title: 印度电信股暴跌，因为最高法院驳回了关于会费的请求
item.description: 印度最高法院驳回了这些公司要求重新计算过去拖欠政府的约 130 亿美元债务的请求，印度无线运营商的股票周四大幅下跌。【原文：Shares of Indian wireless carriers plunged on Thursday after the country’s top court rejected the firms’ request to re-calculate about $13 billion of past dues that they owe to the government.】

item.title: 瑞士钟表业在出口增长的同时仍发出疲软警告
item.description: 瑞士制表商警告说，尽管上个月因贵金属制成的昂贵钟表需求旺盛而导致出口增长，但该行业的前景仍在恶化。【原文：Swiss watchmakers warned of a worsening outlook for the industry, even as exports rose last month on demand for expensive timepieces made of precious metals.】

item.title: 丹麦托普索公司首席执行官希望推迟首次公开募股，暂时保持私有化

item.title: 欧洲 9 月柴油进口量有望创 17 个月新高
item.description: 进入欧盟和英国的柴油货运量将在 9 月份攀升至约 1 年半以来的最高水平，来自中东的货运量反弹有助于抵消美国货运量的小幅下滑。【原文：Diesel cargoes into the European Union and the UK are poised to climb in September to the highest in about 1 1/2 years, with a rebound in shipments from the Middle East helping to offset a small dip in US flows.】

item.title: 什么是循环经济？
item.description: 获取、制造、使用、处置。几十年来，这一直是生产和消费的标准方法。公司获取原材料并将其转化为产品，然后由消费者购买，消费者最终将其丢弃，产生的废物最终被填埋到垃圾填埋场和海洋中。担心气候变化和环境退化的人们正在挑战这种线性模式的可持续性，并呼吁建立一种所谓的循环经济，即获取、制造、使用、再利用和再重复使用。【原文：Take, make, use, dispose. For decades, this has been the standard approach to production and consumption. Companies take raw materials and transform them into products, which are purchased by consumers, who ultimately toss them out, creating waste that ends up in landfills and oceans. People who are worried about climate change and environmental degradation are challenging the sustainability of this linear model and urging a so-called circular economy of take, make, use, reuse and reuse again an】

item.title: 报告称国泰航空发动机起火可能导致重大损失
